intro: Parryella rotundata, commonly known as the roundleaf parryella, is a small, flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Parryella rotundata is a short-lived perennial, typically reaching heights of less than 10 inches.
